name: Siddha maruthuva vakadam
author: Dr. S. Sivasanmugarajah
description: A book that introduces the principles and practices of Siddha medicine, a traditional system of healing that originated in Tamil Nadu. The book covers topics such as the history and philosophy of Siddha medicine, the diagnosis and treatment of various diseases, the use of herbs and minerals, the preparation of medicines, and the role of diet and lifestyle in health. The book is available in Tamil language and has two volumes. The first volume was published in 2010 and the second volume was published in 2011. The book is based on the author’s experience and research as a Siddha practitioner and teacher.

The book covers topics such as the anatomy and physiology of the human body, the diagnosis and treatment of various diseases, the role of diet and lifestyle in health, and the benefits of yoga and meditation. The book is available in Tamil language and was published in 2020 by the Unit of Siddha Medicine, University of Jaffna, Sri Lanka. The book is based on the author’s experience and research as a Siddha practitioner and lecturer.

name: Siddha Medicine
author: Department of Ayush
description: A book on Siddha Medicine authored by the Department of Ayush is likely to provide comprehensive information about the Siddha system of medicine, which is one of the traditional Indian medical systems. The book may cover the following aspects: Historical Context: It may delve into the historical origins and evolution of Siddha Medicine, tracing its roots and development over the centuries. Philosophy and Principles: The book could explain the foundational principles and philosophy of Siddha Medicine, which often emphasize the balance of the body's humors (doshas) and the importance of maintaining equilibrium for health. Diagnosis and Treatment: It may describe the diagnostic methods used in Siddha Medicine, which include traditional methods such as pulse diagnosis, as well as the treatment modalities, including herbal medicines, dietary recommendations, and lifestyle guidance. Herbal Medicine: Siddha Medicine is renowned for its use of herbs and minerals to treat various health conditions. The book might discuss the use of specific herbs and their medicinal properties. Regulatory and Institutional Aspects: The book could provide information about the regulatory framework for Siddha Medicine in India, including the role of the Department of Ayush in promoting and regulating traditional medicine systems.

name: Karabadin Qadri
author: Hakeem Mohammad Akbar Arzani
description: “Karabadin Qadri” is a significant work in the field of Unani medicine, authored by Hakeem Mohammad Akbar Arzani. This book serves as a comprehensive guide to Unani medical practices and principles. It delves into various aspects of health and disease, offering insights into the diagnosis and treatment of numerous ailments. “Karabadin Qadri” is not only a valuable resource for practitioners of Unani medicine but also an interesting read for those interested in traditional healing systems. It reflects the rich medical knowledge and practices that have been passed down through generations.

name: Karabadin Azam
author: Hakeem Mohammad Azam Khan
description: “Karabadin Azam” is a book on Unani medicine written by Hakeem Mohammad Azam Khan. He was a famous physician and scholar who lived in the 19th century. He was the son of Hakeem Mohammad Sharif Khan, the teacher of Hakeem Mohammad Akbar Arzani, the author of “Karabadin Qadri”. The book is a revised and expanded version of his father’s work, “Akseer-e-Azam”. It contains more information on various diseases and their treatments, as well as new recipes for preparing medicines from natural ingredients. The book is divided into four parts: the first part deals with the principles and theories of Unani medicine, the second part describes the properties and uses of different drugs, the third part explains the methods of diagnosis and prognosis, and the fourth part discusses the treatment of various diseases.

name: A Handbook for Gynecology in Unani Medicine Book
author: Ayesha Raza, Shabir Ahamad Bhat, and Suhail Fatima
description: The book is an introduction to the Unani system of medicine, which is based on the humoral theory of Hippocrates. The book explains the basic principles of Unani medicine, such as the four humors, the three faculties, and the temperament of individuals. The book also covers various aspects of Gynecology in Unani medicine, such as the anatomy and physiology of the female reproductive system, the diagnosis and treatment of gynecological disorders, and the management of pregnancy and childbirth. The book is written in a clear and concise manner, making it suitable for students and practitioners of Unani medicine, as well as anyone interested in traditional systems of medicine.

name: Unani Medicine in India
author: Rais-ur-Rahman
description: Unani medicine is a traditional system of medicine that originated in India. It is based on the teachings of Hippocrates and Galen, and it has been practiced in India for over 2,000 years. Unani medicine is a holistic system of medicine that focuses on the prevention and treatment of disease through diet, lifestyle, and herbal remedies. It is based on the concept of the four humors: blood, phlegm, yellow bile, and black bile. The four humors are believed to be the primary constituents of the body, and they are responsible for maintaining health and well-being. The four humors are also believed to be the cause of disease when they are out of balance.

name: Textbook of Cosmetology in Unani Medicine
author: Mohd Khalid and Nazim Husai
description: This book provides a comprehensive overview of medicinal plants used in the Unani system of medicine. It covers a wide range of plants and their therapeutic properties, making it a valuable resource for practitioners, researchers, and students of Unani medicine, as well as those interested in herbal medicine. The book includes detailed information on the botanical characteristics, chemical constituents, pharmacological activities, and traditional uses of each plant. It also discusses the formulation of herbal preparations and their dosage forms. The authors have drawn on their extensive knowledge and experience in the field to create a reliable and informative guide to Unani medicinal plants.

name: Principles Of Unani Medicine

name: Refiguring Unani Tibb: Plural Healing in Late Colonial India
author: Guy N. A. Attewell
description: This book is a study of the Unani system of medicine in late colonial India. It examines the ways in which Unani medicine was refigured by colonial authorities and practitioners, and how it was used to promote a pluralistic approach to health care. The book also explores the role of Unani medicine in the nationalist movement, and how it was used to promote a sense of national identity. The book is based on extensive archival research and interviews with practitioners of Unani medicine.
